etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Giuseppe Baretti (1719–1789), writer. From Italian locanda from post-classical Latin locanda to be let, (short for *camera locanda, *domus locanda room or house to let) use as noun of feminine gerundive of classical Latin locāre to let (property)

definitions: In continental Europe, especially Italy: a small hotel, guest house, or inn.
